forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South southeast wind around 18 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South wind 18 to 26 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the evening descends upon Downtown San Francisco, a steady rain whispers against the pavement, crafting a serene, rhythmical symphony that matches the city’s somber yet captivating allure. Streets glisten beneath a canopy of low, brooding clouds, shrouded in a blanket of mist that hints at the presence of the marine layer hovering just off the coast. The soft glow of streetlights reflects on the wet asphalt, offering a subtle invitation to find comfort in the warm embrace of indoor spaces. Tonight, the atmospheric embrace is fresh, with temperatures gradually ascending as nighttime unfolds.

Tomorrow brings with it the promise of continued rain, casting a cloud over the day filled with whispers of gray. The high near sixty suggests a chill that demands thoughtful layering; a cozy sweater or a light jacket will serve well against the brisk winds that promise to dance through the streets. Ideal excursions for this kind of day might include a leisurely stroll through art galleries or cafes peppered throughout the district, perhaps immersing yourself in a novel or savoring a warm beverage while watching the rain kiss the windows. Alternatively, an afternoon spent wandering the aisles of a local bookstore could offer solace from the elements, providing a gentle escape into realms uncharted. Embrace the somber beauty of this rainy day; it offers a unique canvas on which to paint your own stories.
